name: [INFORMATIONAL] Storable and Cacheable Content
statusMessage:
Alert: Storable and Cacheable Content
Risk: Informational (2 confidence)
Instances: 5
CWE: 524
Description: The response contents are storable by caching components such as proxy servers, and may be retrieved directly from the cache, rather than from the origin server by the caching servers, in response to similar requests from other users. If the response data is sensitive, personal or user-specific, this may result in sensitive information being leaked. In some cases, this may even result in a user gaining complete control of the session of another user, depending on the configuration of the caching
Solution: Validate that the response does not contain sensitive, personal or user-specific information. If it does, consider the use of the following HTTP response headers, to limit, or prevent the content being stored and retrieved from the cache by another user:Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, privatePragma: no-cacheExpires: 0This configuration directs both HTTP 1.0 and HTTP 1.1 compliant caching servers to not store the response, and to not retrieve the response (without validation)

retries.statusDetails:
Alert: Storable but Non-Cacheable Content
Risk: Informational (2 confidence)
Instances: 1
CWE: 524
Description: The response contents are storable by caching components such as proxy servers, but will not be retrieved directly from the cache, without validating the request upstream, in response to similar requests from other users.
